page.title: 10The school
page.content: An Interview with Miss Smith Continued The children learned mental arithmetic, tables, poetry, spellings reading, scripture, history, geography, story writing, drawing and needlework. An inspector came to examine the children's work every termand every three years a report was written about the school. The older children took scholarship exam and if they passed the girls would go the High School in King's Lynn and the boys would go to the Grammar School. In 1956 water was first piped to East Winch. Before that there were no bathrooms or taps in the village.
